context: The so-called <b3_0>"Sack of Palermo"<b3_0/> is one of the major visible faces of the problem. The term is used to indicate the <a0_0>speculative building practices that have filled the city with poor buildings<a0_0/>. <b4_0>The <a1_0>reduced importance of agriculture in the Sicilian economy<b4_0/> has led to a <b5_0>massive migration to the cities<b5_0/><a1_0/>, especially Palermo, which swelled in size, leading to rapid expansion towards the north. <b6_0>The regulatory plans for expansion<b6_0/> was largely ignored in the boom. New parts of town appeared almost out of nowhere, but withou<a2_0>t parks, schools, public buildings, proper roads and the other amenities that characterise a modern city<a2_0/>.
